prompt: In the context of XWiki the 'Bell' in the top right corner is not available, also not when the 'Alert Notification' extension is installed. How can I fix this?
expected_answer: Make sure that notifications are enabled in your wiki. You can enable them by setting the `notifications.enabled` setting in `xwiki.properties` to `true`.
ai_answer:
Sources: https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Model/Validation/UI/ 
https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration%20Application 
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications 
https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/ 


If the 'Bell' icon for notifications is not appearing in XWiki even after installing the 'Alerts Notification' extension, here are some steps you can follow to troubleshoot and potentially fix the issue:

1. **Check Extension Compatibility**: Ensure that the version of the 'Alerts Notification' extension you have installed is compatible with your version of XWiki. Sometimes, features may not work properly if there are compatibility issues.

2. **Verify Installation**: Go to the XWiki Administration area and check if the 'Alerts Notification' extension shows as installed. You can do this by navigating to **Administration > Extensions**. If it's not installed correctly, try reinstalling it.

3. **User Permissions**: Ensure that the user account you are using has the appropriate permissions to view notifications. You may need administrative rights to see certain features.

4. **Browser Issues**: Sometimes, browser extensions or settings can interfere with how XWiki displays content. Try clearing your browser cache or using a different web browser to see if the issue persists.

5. **JavaScript Errors**: Since the notifications rely on JavaScript, check your browser's developer console (usually accessible via F12) for any JavaScript errors that might indicate what the issue is.

6. **Configuration Settings**: Go to **Administration > Notifications** and check the settings related to notifications. Ensure that notifications are enabled and that no settings are preventing their display.

7. **Check for Other Extensions**: Conflicts with other installed extensions could potentially cause the notification feature to malfunction. Consider disabling other extensions temporarily to see if this resolves the issue.

8. **Review Logs**: Check the XWiki logs for any error messages that might indicate problems with loading the notification feature.

If none of these steps resolve the issue, consider reaching out to the XWiki community or support forums with specific details about your installation and the steps you've taken so far.

sources.content:
# Prerequisites & Installation Instructions

We recommend using the [Extension Manager](http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Manager+Application) to install this extension (Make sure that the text "Installable with the Extension Manager" is displayed at the top right location on this page to know if this extension can be installed with the Extension Manager). Note that installing Extensions when being offline is currently not supported and you'd need to use some [complex manual method](https://xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Installation/#HOthermethods).

You can also use the following manual method, which is useful if this extension cannot be installed with the Extension Manager or if you're using an old version of XWiki that doesn't have the Extension Manager:

1. Log in the wiki with a user having Administration rights
2. Go to the Administration page and select the Import category
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to upload the downloaded XAR
4. Click on the uploaded XAR and follow the instructions
5. You'll also need to install all [dependent Extensions](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Model/Validation/UI/#HDependencies) that are not already installed in your wiki

### Things to watch out for

* If you save the configurable application page but you don't have access to the administration page, then your configurable application will not be displayed, instead an error message will tell the administrator that it couldn't be displayed because you couldn't be trusted to run code in the administrator's security context.
* If somebody has administration access but does not have access to save the configurable application, they will get an error message telling them so.
* If somebody has administration access but does not have access to view the configurable application then they will receive an error message on the front page of the administration application. This is because it is possible that not all of the icons could be displayed.
* Documents are locked using Javascript, if the administrator has Javascript turned off then they will receive a warning that the configurable application could not be locked for editing.

# Prerequisites & Installation Instructions

We recommend using the [Extension Manager](http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Manager+Application) to install this extension (Make sure that the text "Installable with the Extension Manager" is displayed at the top right location on this page to know if this extension can be installed with the Extension Manager). Note that installing Extensions when being offline is currently not supported and you'd need to use some [complex manual method](https://xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Installation/#HOthermethods).

You can also use the following manual method, which is useful if this extension cannot be installed with the Extension Manager or if you're using an old version of XWiki that doesn't have the Extension Manager:

There are several ways you can be notified in XWiki:

* [Notifications Application](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HNotificationsApplication)
* [Share Page by mail](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HSharePagebymail)
* [RSS Feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HRSSFeeds)
* [Mentions](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HMentions)
* [What's New](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HWhat27sNew)

# Notifications Application

XWiki 9.3+ You can receive [notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/) in the top bar, under the Alert entry (represented by a bell).

[![notif2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?width=650&rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)



# Share Page by mail

The [Share Page Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Share%20Page%20Application) allows sending a page by mail to someone (another user of the wiki or any email address).

![sharePageDialog.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Share%20Page%20Application/sharePageDialog.png?rev=1.1)

# RSS Feeds

You can also get notification from activity taking place on an XWiki instance [using RSS feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RSS).

# Mentions

XWiki 12.5+ You can get notified when somebody mentions you in pages, comments, or fields supporting xwiki syntax, see [Mentions Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Mentions%20Application/).

# Description

This application contributes content in the Alert menu (contributed by the [Alerts Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Alerts%20Application/)) in the top bar, represented by a bell:

![Notifications.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/Notifications.png?rev=1.4)

You can find under this menu the notifications about some events happening on the wiki (a page has been modified, a new blog post has been posted, etc...).

The number of notifications is displayed on the top menu, just above the bell:

![notif1.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif1.png?rev=1.5)

If you have more than 20 unread notifications, you will not see the real count but this instead:

![MaxCounter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/MaxCounter.png?rev=1.3)

When you open the menu, the content of the notifications is loaded:

![NotificationsLoading.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsLoading.png?rev=1.3)

Then you can see the list of notifications:

[![notif2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)![NotificationsMacro.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsMacro.png?rev=1.3)

If you click on the little button with the "check" icon, you mark the notification as "read". In the future, you will be able to select either you want to see only unread notifications or all of them.

When the notification is read, the button disappear and the background color changes:

# Dependencies

Dependencies for this extension (org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-ui 16.3.1):

* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-preferences-default 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-macro-ui](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Macro/) 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-script 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-filters-default 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-notifiers-default 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-filters-watch 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-rest 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-eventstream-store-solr 16.3.1
* org.webjars:bootstrap-switch 3.3.4
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-velocity](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Velocity%20Macro) 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-icon-script 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-user-profile-ui](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Module/User%20Profile%20Application/) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.rendering:xwiki-rendering-macro-html](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/HTML%20Macro) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-alerts-ui](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Alerts%20Application/) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-date](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Date%20Script%20Service/) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-code](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Code%20Macro/) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-livedata-macro](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Live%20Data%20Macro/) 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-livedata-livetable 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-webjar 16.3.1

## Override default notification templates in wiki pages

A wiki administrator can change the way notifications are displayed in the notification tray using the [NotificationDisplayerClass XObject](http://www.github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-notifications/xwiki-platform-notifications-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/notifications/internal/WikiNotificationDisplayerDocumentInitializer.java). You can get more informations about this feature in the [Notifications API documentation](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Module/#HCreatecustomnotificationtemplates).

# Prerequisites & Installation Instructions

We recommend using the [Extension Manager](http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Manager+Application) to install this extension (Make sure that the text "Installable with the Extension Manager" is displayed at the top right location on this page to know if this extension can be installed with the Extension Manager). Note that installing Extensions when being offline is currently not supported and you'd need to use some [complex manual method](https://xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Installation/#HOthermethods).

You can also use the following manual method, which is useful if this extension cannot be installed with the Extension Manager or if you're using an old version of XWiki that doesn't have the Extension Manager:

1. Log in the wiki with a user having Administration rights
2. Go to the Administration page and select the Import category
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to upload the downloaded XAR
4. Click on the uploaded XAR and follow the instructions
5. You'll also need to install all [dependent Extensions](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDependencies) that are not already installed in your wiki

# Administrators

Administrators can go to Administration > Notifications to configure some settings about the notifications.

![NotificationsAdministration.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsAdministration.png?rev=1.5)

Some properties can be overridden by users. The inheritance is "Main Wiki preferences < Current Wiki preferences < User preferences".

XWiki 13.2+ Administrators can also directly change users' notification settings by going to their profile and click on "Notifications" tab in the menu. The UI is the same as what the user is seeing to customize their own notification settings.

## Enabling notifications for all users by default

In the administration, you can select which application and/or event types should be enabled by default for all users. 

## Choosing the default frequency of notification emails

XWiki 14.10+ Administrators can select the default frequency used for sending emails to users about the changes that have happened on the wiki. This frequency is set to *Daily* by default.

## Choosing the default level of details about the changes in the email

Administrators can select the level of details that users receive on the email, about the changes that have happened to the wiki.

## Choosing the default auto-watched mode

Administrators can select what is the default auto watching page behavior.

![AutoWatchModeAdmin.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/AutoWatchModeAdmin.png?rev=1.3)

You can also edit the xwiki.properties file:

#-# [Since 9.11.8]  
#-# [Since 10.6RC1]  
#-# The automatic watch mode used by default. The value can be changed by an administrator in the wiki's administration  
#-# or by any user in their own settings.  
#-#  
#-# Possible values:  
#-#  
#-# - none:  no page is added to the list of watched pages automatically.

## Get a notification RSS feed

You can get a RSS feed of the notifications occurring in your wiki. This feed can be accessed either through a link in your notification tray (or at the bottom of the notifications macro).

![NotificationTrayRSSLink.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationTrayRSSLink.png?rev=1.3)  
![NotificationsWithRSS.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsWithRSS.png?rev=1.3)

## Notifications Macro

The [Notifications Macro is provided by its own application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Macro/).

# Settings

On the notifications menu, you also have a link to go to the "settings" of the notifications.

![notif4.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif4.png?rev=1.8)

By default, users only get notifications when they are mentioned or when actions are performed on pages they created or updated. For receiving other notifications, you need to select which "types" of notifications you want to receive. When a page is created? When a blog post is published?

You can enable or disable all notification types that belong to a particular application by clicking on the bells associated to this application. If some types are enabled and other are disabled inside an application, the switch looks like the next screenshot, meaning that the application's notifications are partially enabled:

![NotifUndeterminate.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotifUndeterminate.png?rev=1.3)

Note that you only receive notifications that occur after you turn on the notifications types.
